meanings.definition: To plan together secretly to commit an illegal or wrongful act.
meanings.sent1: The group was conspiring to steal the treasure from the museum.
meanings.sent2: The criminals were caught conspiring to rob the bank.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon characters were conspiring to outsmart the villain.
meanings.sent4: The shadows on the wall seemed to be conspiring against him.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds and thunder were conspiring to ruin the picnic.

meanings.definition: To act in harmony toward a common end.
meanings.sent1: The birds were conspiring to build their nests in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The team members were conspiring to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients in the recipe were conspiring to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The waves and the wind were conspiring to create a perfect surfing day.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting were conspiring to create a beautiful masterpiece.
